1.title: Pilot
1.description: A strangely eccentric genius scientist and inventor, moves into the home of his daughter and her family and begins to strongly influence his young grandson.

1.title: Lawnmower Dog
1.description: Rick helps Jerry out with the dog.

1.title: Anatomy Park
1.description: It's Christmas. Rick shrinks Morty, injecting him into a homeless man to save Anatomy Park. Jerry tries to have a Christmas free of electronic devices, but regrets his decision when his parents introduce him to their new friend.

1.title: M. Night Shaym-Aliens!
1.description: Rick and Morty try to get to the bottom of a mystery.

1.title: Meeseeks and Destroy
1.description: Rick provides the family with a solution to their problems, freeing him up to go on an adventure led by Morty.

1.title: Rick Potion #9
1.description: After Rick gives Morty a love potion for a school dance, things quickly spiral out of control when the serum splices with the flu - causing it to spread. Rick and Morty scramble to cure the crisis, making matters worse in the process.

1.title: Raising Gazorpazorp
1.description: Morty becomes a father to an alien baby, while Rick and Summer get trapped in a dangerous dimension.

1.title: Rixty Minutes
1.description: Rick hooks up the family's TV with interdimensional cable, allowing them to watch infinite TV from across the multiverse.

1.title: Something Ricked This Way Comes
1.description: Summer gets a job at a pawn shop owned by the devil. Jerry helps Morty with his science fair project.

1.title: Close Rick-counters of the Rick Kind
1.description: Rick, falsely blamed for Murder by the council of Ricks, begins a cross-dimensional pursuit with the authorities while attempting to prove his innocence.

1.title: Ricksy Business
1.description: Beth and Jerry head for an iceberg of a date leaving Rick in charge. Morty doesn't get to go on any more adventures if the house isn't in the same condition when they get back.

2.title: A Rickle in Time
2.description: Having restarted time, Rick, Morty and Summer are in a quantum-uncertain state of existence. An argument leads to the creation of two alternate timelines, which need to be stitched back together fast if they are to escape quantum collapse.

2.title: Mortynight Run
2.description: Rick and Morty try to save a gas life form while Jerry resides in a daycare made for Jerrys.

2.title: Auto Erotic Assimilation
2.description: Rick gets emotional. Beth and Jerry get into a fight.

2.title: Total Rickall
2.description: The Smith house is locked down after parasites threaten to take over the world by multiplying through flashbacks.

2.title: Get Schwifty
2.description: Rick and morty must aid Earth after a giant head disrupts the planet, demanding to see a hit song performed.

2.title: The Ricks Must Be Crazy
2.description: Rick is having trouble with his car and they have to fix it by traveling to the microverse.

2.title: Big Trouble in Little Sanchez
2.description: Rick joins in on some hijinks by transferring his consciousness into teenage "Tiny Rick." Beth and Jerry sort out their relationship.

2.title: Interdimensional Cable 2: Tempting Fate
2.description: Jerry is faced with the difficult decision of losing his manhood in order to save an alien leader from imminent death. Meanwhile, Rick, Morty and Summer explore the possibilities of interdimensional television.

2.title: Look Who's Purging Now
2.description: Rick and Morty arrive on an alien planet to fix their ship just as the day of the purge begins there, Jerry and Summer work on their father-daughter relationship, but his lack of employment keeps coming up.

2.title: The Wedding Squanchers
2.description: The Smith family is invited to the wedding of Rick's best friend, Birdperson. Things go south when it's discovered that the bride isn't who she says she is.

3.title: The Rickshank Rickdemption
3.description: Rick, still in galactic prison, puts an intricate escape plan into action. Back on Earth, which is now under federation control, Morty and Summer have an argument about their grandpa.

3.title: Rickmancing the Stone
3.description: With the kids dealing with their parents' divorce, Rick takes them to a Mad Max-style universe where he tries to steal a green crystal from a group of scavengers.

3.title: Pickle Rick
3.description: Rick turns himself into a pickle while Beth, Summer, and Morty go to family therapy.

3.title: Vindicators 3: The Return of Worldender
3.description: Rick and Morty are summoned by the Vindicators to stop Worldender but end up in a deathtrap conceived by Drunk Rick.

3.title: The Whirly Dirly Conspiracy
3.description: Rick takes Jerry on a sympathy adventure to a resort where everyone is immortal when there, and Jerry meets some old acquaintances of Rick's who want payback.

3.title: Rest and Ricklaxation
3.description: Following a stressful adventure, Rick and Morty go on a break to a spa where they remove their toxins, which in turn take a form of their own.

3.title: The Ricklantis Mixup
3.description: Whilst Rick and Morty go off to adventure in Atlantis, we take a look at how the Citadel has rebuilt itself since both Rick and Morty visited.

3.title: Morty's Mind Blowers
3.description: Rick reveals to Morty his "Morty's mind blowers," a collection of memories Morty asked Rick to erase from his mind.

3.title: The ABCs of Beth
3.description: Rick brings Beth to a world he created for her when she was younger while Beth looks for a long-lost childhood friend trapped there for years.

3.title: The Rickchurian Mortydate
3.description: Rick and Morty are called upon by the president to kill a vicious alien in the secret tunnels under the White House.

4.title: Edge of Tomorty: Rick Die Rickpeat
4.description: Rick brings Morty to a planet containing crystals that show whoever is touching them all the ways they may die depending on their choices.

4.title: The Old Man and the Seat
4.description: Rick goes to his private bathroom to find that someone else has used it. Jerry creates an app with an unlikely alien and Morty pays the price.

4.title: One Crew over the Crewcoo's Morty
4.description: On a treasure-seeking expedition in an alien temple, Rick and Morty discover that a heist expert has snatched the prize from under their noses. Further twists, turns and double-crosses abound.

4.title: Claw and Hoarder: Special Ricktim's Morty
4.description: Morty asks Rick for a dragon and Rick finds a wizard of another dimension who makes a soul bonding contract between Morty and a dragon called Balthromaw. Meanwhile, Jerry meets a talking cat in his bedroom who wants to fly to Florida.

4.title: Rattlestar Ricklactica
4.description: Morty discovers a race of intelligent space snakes after suffering a potentially lethal bite. Jerry attempts to prove that he isn't completely incompetent.

4.title: Never Ricking Morty
4.description: An anthology episode that follows Rick and Morty on a train with people who don't like Rick. They have to find their way out but they bump into unexpected situations along the way.

4.title: Promortyus
4.description: Rick, Morty and Summer visit an alien civilisation, where Rick and Morty are controlled by parasites and Summer lives a luxurious lifestyle.

4.title: The Vat of Acid Episode
4.description: Rick & Morty go on a simple exchange as Rick tells Morty if something goes wrong jump into the same vat of acid as he does.

4.title: Childrick of Mort
4.description: Rick, Morty, Beth, Summer and Jerry share a galactic adventure.

4.title: Star Mort Rickturn of the Jerri
4.description: An adventure with an invisibility belt, but a family that disappears together, must stay together.

5.title: Mort Dinner Rick Andre
5.description: Rick hosts dinner for his ocean dwelling nemesis, while Morty gets the wine.

5.title: Mortyplicity
5.description: The Smiths suspect they're being hunted. But who's even real?

5.title: A Rickconvenient Mort
5.description:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

5.title: Gotron Jerrysis Rickvangelion
5.description:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Avatar: The Last Airbender
1.description: Sokka and his sister Kya - later renamed Katara, must travel the world to find masters for Aang, who is the Avatar. However, they must evade a critical foe, Prince Zuko of the Fire Nation, who wants to capture Aang.

1.title: The Boy in the Iceberg
1.description: The legend of the Avatar is told. Katara and Sokka find a strange boy within an iceberg.

1.title: The Avatar Returns
1.description: Aang and Katara inadvertently set off a trap the brings the warmongering Fire Nation to the Southern Water Tribe's peaceful village at the South Pole.

1.title: The Southern Air Temple
1.description: After his departure from the Southern Air Temple 100 years ago, an excited Aang finally returns home but is disillusioned by what he finds there.

1.title: The Warriors of Kyoshi
1.description: The gang arrives at Kyoshi Island and are captured by some Kyoshi warriors. When Aang reveals that he is the avatar, news quickly spreads out and suddenly reaches to Prince Zuko who then goes to Kyoshi Island to capture him.

1.title: The King of Omashu
1.description: Aang's abilities as an airbender are challenged by a king.

1.title: Imprisoned
1.description: In a nearby Earth Village, the gang meets a teenage earthbender named Haru. This village lives in fear of the Fire Nation, for soldiers there capture any earthbenders they can find.

1.title: The Spirit World: Winter Solstice, Part 1
1.description: Aang and friends visit a village being terrorized by an angry spirit. Iroh is captured by Earth Kingdom soldiers.

1.title: Avatar Roku: Winter Solstice, Part 2
1.description: To contact the spirit of the previous Avatar, Aang must reach a temple in the Fire Nation before the sun sets on the following day. There he will learn what he must do to restore balance to the world. Zuko must defy his banishment to follow Aang.

1.title: The Waterbending Scroll
1.description: Katara, desperate to improve her abilities and teach Aang, steals an expensive waterbending scroll from pirates, causing them to pursue the group.

1.title: Jet
1.description: Aang, Katara, and Sokka have their friendship tested by a charismatic Rebel Leader who is fighting against the Fire Nation.

1.title: The Great Divide
1.description: Aang is tested as the Avatar when he must help two feuding clans cross a dangerous canyon peacefully.

1.title: The Storm
1.description: Aang relives the events after finding out that he is the Avatar 100 years ago and tells them to Katara, while Iroh tells the story of Zuko's scar and banishment to the crew.

1.title: The Blue Spirit
1.description: When Aang is captured by the Fire Nation, his only hope is a mysterious masked figure.

1.title: The Fortuneteller
1.description: The gang visits a village where a fortuneteller lives who is said to never be wrong. Aang tries to show Katara how he feels about her.

1.title: Bato of the Water Tribe
1.description: Sokka and Katara meet a friend of their father who offers to take them to join the Water Tribe's navy. Aang fears his friends will choose seeing their father again over staying with him.

1.title: The Deserter
1.description: When he meets an outcast from the Fire Nation, Aang is impatient to skip ahead in his training.

1.title: The Northern Air Temple
1.description: Aang is upset when he finds an old Air Temple has been desecrated by an old inventor and his son.

1.title: The Waterbending Master
1.description: The heroes finally arrive at the North Pole. But for Katara, the trip may have been in vain, as Master Pakku refuses to teach girls waterbending.

1.title: The Siege of the North, Part 1
1.description: While Katara herself becomes a great waterbending master, Commander Zhao plans a siege on the Northern Water Tribe. Meanwhile, Sokka's on a mission to stop this siege while Aang tries to buy them some time.

1.title: The Siege of the North, Part 2
1.description: As the Fire Nation continues its assault on the Northern Water Tribe, Sokka, Katara and Yue set out on a search for Aang, being guided by his spirit.

2.title: The Avatar State
2.description: Aang and friends arrive in the Earth Kingdom to begin his earthbending training, but a local general convinces Aang that all he needs to do is learn to control his Avatar state. Azula, Zuko's sister, arrives to escort her brother and uncle back to the Fire Nation.

2.title: The Cave of Two Lovers
2.description: On their way to Omashu, Team Avatar is forced to travel underground to avoid Fire Nation attacks. Iroh and Zuko adjust to life as fugitives.

2.title: Return to Omashu
2.description: Finding the city of Aang's old friend, King Bumi, captured by the Fire Nation, the heroes hatch a plan to rescue Aang's earthbending teacher. Azula gathers two old friends to help her hunt the Avatar.

2.title: The Swamp
2.description: Aang hears a swamp calling to him. In the swamp, Aang and the gang find out that this is not any natural swamp.

2.title: Avatar Day
2.description: Sokka and Katara have to solve a centuries-old crime when Aang is imprisoned for a murder allegedly committed by one of his past incarnations.

2.title: The Blind Bandit
2.description: While looking for an Earthbending teacher, Aang, and his friends discover a young blind girl with secrets of her own.

2.title: Zuko Alone
2.description: As Zuko tries to make it by in exile without his uncle, he remembers how his father became Firelord and what happened to his mother.

2.title: The Chase
2.description: Every time they land, Azula and her warriors find Aang, Katara, Sokka, and Toph. Toph refuses to help set up camp, claiming she carries her own weight and no one else's. After a fight between Aang, Katara and Toph, Toph storms off angrily. Aang lays a decoy trail for Azula and Sokka, Katara, Appa, and Momo, flee the other direction. Aang waits for Azula and is fighting her when Zuko and Iroh arrive. Soon, Katara, and Sokka come to the fight, too. Just as all hope of winning is lost, Toph arrives and, together, the six attack Azula. Knowing she is beat, Azula shoots ...

2.title: Bitter Work
2.description: Aang begins to learn earthbending from Toph; Uncle Iroh resumes teaching Zuko firebending to better prepare him for facing Azula, and reveals a new technique he learned from watching waterbenders.

2.title: The Library
2.description: When he learns that there is a lost Library with all the knowledge in the world, Sokka convinces the others to seek it out in hopes of finding a weakness of the Fire Nation.

2.title: The Desert
2.description: Lost in the desert without Appa, Team Avatar must find a way out. Iroh and Zuko make contact with a secret organization.

2.title: The Serpent's Pass
2.description: After getting tickets for the ferry headed to Ba Sing Se, the gang meets an old friend. They skip the ferry ride to help some refugees, one of which is going to have a baby, get to Ba Sing Se. They must lead the refugees through the Serpent's Pass, a dangerous mountain-side path surrounded by water.

2.title: The Drill
2.description: After arriving at the great wall of Ba Sing Se, Aang and the gang discover that the Fire Nation has constructed a great drilling machine to penetrate the wall. The drill is also followed by an army of Fire Nation troops. Also, Zuko and Iroh are having trouble hiding the fact that they are both Firebenders.

2.title: City of Walls and Secrets
2.description: After getting a house to stay in, Aang and company are given a tour of Ba Sing Se. As they try to get in to tell the Earth King the news, they find that nothing is quite what is seems. Jet is in the city, too, and he is positive that Iroh and Zuko are Firebenders.

2.title: The Tales of Ba Sing Se
2.description: A series of short stories covering some of the time spent by Katara, Toph, Iroh, Sokka, Aang, Zuko and Momo as they live in Ba Sing Se.

2.title: Appa's Lost Days
2.description: In this special episode, we go back in time to the moment Appa was stolen, will find out where he has gone and who he has met along the way and more importantly where he is now!

2.title: Lake Laogai
2.description: The Avatar gang encounters Jet in Ba Sing Se and he helps them to discover the location of Appa. But they will end up discovering something else, a secret of the city.

2.title: The Earth King
2.description: The kids battle Long Feng and the Dai Li when they attempt to show the Earth King the vast conspiracy taking place in his city. Zuko becomes seriously ill and has feverish dreams as he faces a spiritual crisis.

2.title: The Guru
2.description: Aang receives guidance from Guru Pathik at the Eastern Air Temple; Sokka is reunited with his long-lost father; Princess Azula has something diabolical in store for her enemies; Uncle and Zuko run their own tea shop.

2.title: The Crossroads of Destiny
2.description: The heroes work together to stop Azula's destructive plans; Zuko finds companionship in an unlikely source and learns the time has come to make an imperative choice about his future.

3.title: The Awakening
3.description: Weeks after the fall of the Earth Kingdom, Aang and his friends must infiltrate the Fire Nation. Katara meets her father for the first time in years. Zuko returns home, but is uneasy with his newfound reputation.

3.title: The Headband
3.description: Posing as a regular kid, Aang goes to a Fire Nation school and sees what's missing from their lives. Zuko visits his uncle in prison.

3.title: The Painted Lady
3.description: When Aang and his friends come across a fishing village being poisoned by a nearby factory, a local legend comes to life to help the townspeople.

3.title: Sokka's Master
3.description: After deciding he's the least valuable member of the team, Sokka seeks an apprenticeship with a sword-master. The rest of the gang tries to adjust to being without him. The imprisoned Iroh may not be as beaten as he seems.

3.title: The Beach
3.description: On a forced vacation, Zuko, Azula, Ty Lee and Mai try to blend in with normal teenagers and learn about themselves and one another. Aang and company are attacked by an ominous assassin.

3.title: The Avatar and the Fire Lord
3.description: Both Aang and Zuko must learn the history of how the war began. Zuko learns a secret about his great-grandfather's past.

3.title: The Runaway
3.description: When Toph discovers a quick way to make cash, Katara disapproves, and the rift between them has disastrous consequences.

3.title: The Puppetmaster
3.description: Creepy things are afoot when the gang meets a mysterious old innkeeper with a secret.

3.title: Nightmares and Daydreams
3.description: As the invasion approaches, Aang has recurring nightmares about being unprepared to face the Firelord. Zuko feels the perks and pressures of being the prince again.

3.title: Day of the Black Sun
3.description: Zuko makes a decision about his future. Aang reunites with many of his old friends in a full-scale invasion of the Fire Nation capitol to coincide with an eclipse which will remove the Fire Nation's powers.

3.title: Day of the Black Sun
3.description: The invasion seems to be succeeding until Aang learns that their arrival was anticipated. Zuko confronts his father.

3.title: The Western Air Temple
3.description: The gang hides out in the Western Air Temple. Zuko tries to convince the gang of his change in heart, but they are very hesitant. Combustion Man/Sparky-Sparky Boom Man attacks again.

3.title: The Firebending Masters
3.description: Zuko has joined up with Aang's group and is now ready to teach Aang fire bending. Unfortunately, Zuko has found out that he has lost his ability and must now relearn it. Zuko and Aang travel to find the original source of fire bending so that they both can learn from The Firebending Masters.

3.title: The Boiling Rock: Part 1
3.description: Sokka and Zuko head to the Fire Nation's most heavily guarded prison, the Boiling Rock, in hopes of finding and breaking out the captured invasion force.

3.title: The Boiling Rock
3.description: The escape is planned and the heroes attempt to break from the prison that very day. But problems come when Azula, Mai and Ty Lee arrive at the prison.

3.title: The Southern Raiders
3.description: Trying to prove that she can trust him, Zuko helps Katara track down the man who killed her mother.

3.title: The Ember Island Players
3.description: The gang, now hiding at Ember Island, watch a play about themselves and their adventures.

3.title: Sozin's Comet
3.description: Sozin's Comet is only three days away. Zuko tells the others what the Fire Lord plans on the day of the comet and the gang realizes that they must stop him before then. But Aang doubts that he can do what is expected of him.

3.title: Sozin's Comet
3.description: Aang awakes on a mysterious island and confronts his past lives for advice on how to stop the Fire Lord without killing him. The rest of the group searches for Aang.

3.title: Sozin's Comet
3.description: Zuko battles his sister with Katara's help for the right to be named Fire Lord. Elsewhere, Aang meets Ozai just as the comet arrives.

3.title: Sozin's Comet, Part 4: Avatar Aang
3.description: Aang's moment of truth arrives. Can he defeat Ozai, the Phoenix King? Will he be forced to take a human life? All the characters face their greatest challenges.

1.title: Tourist Trapped
1.description: After finding a strange book in the forest, Dipper begins to learn about the dark side of Gravity Falls, and suspects that Mabel's new boyfriend is a zombie.

1.title: The Legend of the Gobblewonker
1.description: Stan takes the kids fishing for the day, but they ditch him to search for a lake monster called the Gobblewonker in order to win a photo contest.

1.title: Headhunters
1.description: The kids discover Stan's collection of wax sculptures, and Mabel decides to create her own. But when someone sabotages it, it's up to her and Dipper to solve the case.

1.title: The Hand That Rocks the Mabel
1.description: Dipper and Mabel go to see Stan's arch nemesis, a psychic by the name of Lil' Gideon, who becomes obsessed with Mabel.

1.title: The Inconveniencing
1.description: Dipper tries to impress Wendy by going along with her and her friends to an abandoned convenience store that may be haunted.

1.title: Dipper vs. Manliness
1.description: In order to become more manly, Dipper seeks the help of a gang of minotaurs in the forest. Meanwhile, Mabel gives Stan a makeover.

1.title: Double Dipper
1.description: Stan throws a big party to promote the Mystery Shack, while Dipper uses a strange photocopier to make clones of himself, so that he can impress Wendy.

1.title: Irrational Treasure
1.description: During Gravity Falls' Pioneer Day celebration, the kids attempt to uncover a conspiracy about the town's real founder.

1.title: The Time Traveler's Pig
1.description: Dipper ruins a chance to impress Wendy at a fair, forcing him to use a time machine to travel back and stop it from happening.

1.title: Fight Fighters
1.description: Dipper is challenged to a fight by Wendy's boyfriend Robbie, and brings video game character Rumble McSkirmish to life in order to serve as his bodyguard.

1.title: Little Dipper
1.description: Dipper finds a magic crystal with the ability to grow and shrink anything, but Gideon gets his hands on it and tries to get revenge on Stan and take the Mystery Shack.

1.title: Summerween
1.description: It's Summerween, and Dipper and Mabel are visited by a monster called the Summerween Trickster, who informs them they must collect 500 pieces of candy, or be eaten.

1.title: Boss Mabel
1.description: Mabel is in charge of the Mystery Shack after making a bet with Stan to see who can the most money in three days, and determine which of them is the better boss.

1.title: Bottomless Pit!
1.description: Dipper, Mabel, Stan, and Soos accidentally fall into the Mystery Shack's bottomless pit and tell each other stories to pass the time.

1.title: The Deep End
1.description: It's the hottest day of the Summer and the opening day of the Gravity Falls pool, where Mabel befriends a mysterious boy named Mermando.

1.title: Carpet Diem
1.description: Dipper wants his own room and when Soos finds one in the shack, Stan makes Dipper and Mabel compete for it. Meanwhile, Dipper has found out that the shag rug inside let's you switch bodies with whomever you shock.

1.title: Boyz Crazy
1.description: When Mabel Discovers that her favourite boy band is actually a bunch of imprisoned clones, she sets them free, only to decide on keeping them for herself; Dipper is convinced that Robbie plans to brainwash Wendy with a secret message.

1.title: Land Before Swine
1.description: A dinosaur loose in Gravity Falls snatches up Mabel's pig, Waddles, leading the Pines family on a prehistoric journey to get him back.

1.title: Dreamscaperers
1.description: Dipper, Mabel and Soos go through Stan's mind to defeat a tricky demon summoned by Lil Gideon.

1.title: Gideon Rises
1.description: When Lil' Gideon takes over the Shack, Dipper and Mabel try to defeat him.

2.title: Scary-oke
2.description: The Pines Family resolves to get back to normal by throwing a "Mystery Shack is Back" party ... but nothing is normal in Gravity Falls!

2.title: Into the Bunker
2.description: When Dipper's secret journal pages lead him and the gang to the author's hidden bunker, they find themselves coming face to face with a mysterious figure from Gravity Falls' history.

2.title: The Golf War
2.description: After being belittled by Pacifica too many times, Mabel challenges her to a miniature golf off, which gets out of control when some local residents offer their help.

2.title: Sock Opera
2.description: Close to unlocking the author's laptop, Dipper is visited by the demon Bill, who wants to make a deal. Mabel puts on a puppet show to impress a boy.

2.title: Soos and the Real Girl
2.description: Soos makes a promise to his grandma that he can find a girlfriend in one week, and buys a dating simulator game to help him learn how to talk to women.

2.title: Little Gift Shop of Horrors
2.description: Stan tells a series of three spooky tales to an unlucky customer at the Mystery Shack after hours.

2.title: Society of the Blind Eye
2.description: Dipper and the gang discover a secret society that has been erasing the memories of the citizens of Gravity Falls.

2.title: Blendin's Game
2.description: Blendin returns to face off with Dipper and Mabel in a futuristic battle that could trap them forever in time jail.

2.title: The Love God
2.description: After seeing Robbie's sadness over his and Wendy's breakup, Mabel steals a love potion from a Love God.

2.title: Northwest Mansion Mystery
2.description: Pacifica invites Dipper over to her mansion in order to get rid of a ghost.

2.title: Not What He Seems
2.description: The twins wonder if they really know Grunkle Stan after he is taken into custody by the government agents.

2.title: A Tale of Two Stans
2.description: The reuniting of the Pine brothers Stanford and Stanley. A series of flashbacks from their lives are shown, and their history together is explained.

2.title: Dungeons, Dungeons, and More Dungeons
2.description: Dipper finds an unlikely friend to join him with his newest obsession- a nerdy board game called "Dungeons, Dungeons and More Dungeons."

2.title: The Stanchurian Candidate
2.description: When Grunkle Stan decides to run for mayor, Dipper and Mabel have their work cut out for them trying to turn their gaffe-prone uncle into the perfect candidate.

2.title: The Last Mabelcorn
2.description: A new threat leads Mabel to venture into the enchanted realm of the unicorns. Meanwhile, Dipper learns an unexpected twist about the enigmatic Bill Cipher.

2.title: Roadside Attraction
2.description: Grunkle Stan takes the kids with him on a road-trip to sabotage all the other tourist traps in Oregon.

2.title: Dipper and Mabel vs. the Future
2.description: As Dipper and Mabel's 13th birthday approaches, Ford and Dipper go on a dangerous mission.

2.title: Weirdmageddon: Part 1
2.description: Bill has returned to take down the Pines family. But this time he has brought some of his friends with him.

2.title: Weirdmageddon 2: Escape from Reality
2.description: While Dipper, Soos, and Wendy try to save Mabel from a strange new world, Bill's forces plan their next move.

2.title: Weirdmageddon 3: Take Back the Falls
2.description: The Pines family make their greatest sacrifice yet and arrive at their ultimate fate following a final showdown with Bill.

1.title: Welcome to Republic City
1.description: Korra, the new Avatar, travels to Republic city to start her Airbending training.

1.title: A Leaf in the Wind
1.description: Against Tenzin's prohibition, a frustrated Korra sneaks out to visit the pro-bending sports arena.

1.title: The Revelation
1.description: Korra attempts to infiltrate the Equalist movement and learn more about its mysterious leader.

1.title: The Voice in the Night
1.description: Korra becomes part of Councilman Tarrlok's task force which aims to rid Republic City of the Equalists.

1.title: The Spirit of Competition
1.description: As Asami steals Mako's heart, Korra struggles to express her feelings for Mako and also at the same time Bolin tries to win Korra's heart by being brave enough to ask Korra to go out with him. The tension gets higher as the Pro bending tournament starts.

1.title: And the Winner Is...
1.description: Korra and the Fire Ferrets are in the pro-bending championship, but will the Equalists allow the game to go on?

1.title: The Aftermath
1.description: Korra suspects that an ally is working with the Equalists.

1.title: When Extremes Meet
1.description: Korra faces off with Councilman Tarrlok as Equalist activity continues to rise in Republic City.

1.title: Out of the Past
1.description: After being imprisoned by Tarrlok, Korra attempts to analyze the mysterious visions she has been having. Meanwhile, Tenzin, Lin, Mako, Bolin and Asami search for Korra, having been given false information by Tarrlok.

1.title: Turning the Tides
1.description: The Equalists begin their attack on Republic City.

1.title: Skeletons in the Closet
1.description: Korra and the rest of Team Avatar go into hiding in Gommu's underground shelter where benders and non-benders live together in harmony.

1.title: Endgame
1.description: The duel between Amon and Korra - will Korra be powerful enough to beat Amon?

2.title: Rebel Spirit
2.description: Korra struggles to find a deeper connection with the Spirit World as she and the gang attend a Southern Water Tribe festival.

2.title: The Southern Lights
2.description: Korra and Chief Unalaq journey into a dangerous maelstrom and find a source of great spiritual power.

2.title: Civil Wars: Part 1
2.description: While tensions flare between the Northern and Southern Water Tribes, Korra struggles to remain neutral.

2.title: Civil Wars: Part 2
2.description: When Korra's parents are wrongfully arrested, Korra fights for their freedom.

2.title: Peacekeepers
2.description: When the President of the United Republic refuses to help Korra, she decides to take matters into her own hands.

2.title: The Sting
2.description: When Triad activity threatens to put Future Industries out of business, Mako performs an investigation and discovers a much bigger conspiracy.

2.title: Beginnings, Part 1
2.description: Korra learns about the epic and mythic origins of the first Avatar.

2.title: Beginnings, Part 2
2.description: Korra delves deeper into the Avatar's past and realizes what she must do in order to restore balance between the physical and spirit worlds.

2.title: The Guide
2.description: Korra seeks Tenzin's help to enter the Spirit World for the first time.

2.title: A New Spiritual Age
2.description: Korra enters the Spirit World and struggles with the Avatar's relationship with the spirits.

2.title: Night of a Thousand Stars
2.description: When President Raiko is attacked, Bolin saves the day.

2.title: Harmonic Convergence
2.description: Korra and company attempt to close the spirit portals before Harmonic Convergence.

2.title: Darkness Falls
2.description: Korra discovers a new twist in Unalaq's evil plan. Meanwhile, Tenzin realizes he must face his own demons in order to save his daughter.

2.title: Light in the Dark
2.description: Korra discovers a way she may be able to defeat the ultimate dark spirit and save the world.

3.title: A Breath of Fresh Air
3.description: As Korra tries to restore the streets of Republic city, she learns that her decision to keep the spirit portals open has created a new conflict between humans and spirits, and triggered the emerging of new Airbenders.

3.title: Rebirth
3.description: As the Avatar team faces difficulties while searching for new airbenders, Zaheer makes the next step in his plan.

3.title: The Earth Queen
3.description: Korra and Asami collect tax money for Queen Hou Ting. Mako and Bolin suffer an unexpected family reunion. Kai can't get rid of his old habit. Lord Zuko visits a secret prison in Northen Water Tribe.

3.title: In Harm's Way
3.description: Korra finds out that the Earth Queen imprisoned airbenders to create an army. Jenora leads an investigation with her spiritual projection. Lin joins the Avatar Team.

3.title: The Metal Clan
3.description: Korra, Mako, Bolin and Asami visit Sao Fu, the city of Metal Clan. Lin does not want to meet her past. Suyin tells her life story. Air Temple Island training camp has a new recruit.

3.title: Old Wounds
3.description: Korra practices metal bending. Lin takes an acupuncture session. Zaheer, Ghazan, Ming-Hua and P'Li escape Republic City.

3.title: Original Airbenders
3.description: Though contending with Bumi's bad attitude, Tenzin tries to train the new members of the Air Nation.

3.title: The Terror Within
3.description: As Opal leaves for the Northern Air Temple to start her airbending training, Zaheer and his gang try to kidnap Korra. Although Korra's friends are able to prevent this following a climactic fight, they suspect that someone inside Zaofu has been aiding the enemy.

3.title: The Stakeout
3.description: While tracking Aiwei, Korra finds out more about Zaheer's motivations and purposes. Team Avatar is chased by both Zaheer's gang and the Earth Queen.

3.title: Long Live the Queen
3.description: Korra and Asami are captured by Earth Kingdom forces and held in an airship en route to Ba Sing Se, and Asami's escape plan leads to a worse situation.

3.title: The Ultimatum
3.description: As Ba Sing Se continues to erupt into chaos, Mako and Bolin struggle to leave the city to deliver Zaheer's message to Korra they were going to attack the Northern Air Temple.

3.title: Enter the Void
3.description: Team Avatar hatches a plan to save the Airbenders, but all is not what it seems like. Zaheer rediscovers an old Airbender talent. The motive of the Red Lotus is finally revealed.

3.title: Venom of the Red Lotus
3.description: After being captured and poisoned by the Red Lotus, Korra must fight to keep herself from being killed in the Avatar State, which would end the entire Avatar Cycle forever.

4.title: After All These Years
4.description: The Metal Clan's new leader Kuvira is making some big changes. In Republic City, people are waiting to see Korra again but something is wrong.

4.title: Korra Alone
4.description: While Korra is struggling with PTSD by the metal poison Zaheer injected in her, she sets off on a journey to try to connect with Raava. Amidst all of this, Tenzin and the others realize that Korra has gone missing after 6 months.

4.title: The Coronation
4.description: The Coronation of the new King of Earth Kingdom while Kuvira does not agree with it. While on other hand Korra is practicing with Toph to better herself.

4.title: The Calling
4.description: The airbender children, Jinora, Ikki and Meelo, head out to find the Avatar. Meanwhile, Toph teaches Korra to let go of the past.

4.title: Enemy at the Gates
4.description: Kuvira threatens Zaofu; Bolin is caught in the middle of the bad blood between Su Beifong and Kuvira.

4.title: The Battle of Zaofu
4.description: Korra returns to her role as the avatar, but is she really ready for action? Bolin and Varrick break away from Kuvira's army.

4.title: Reunion
4.description: Korra returns to Republic city and team avatar faces their first mission together in 3 years when prince Wu goes missing. Bolin and Varick are on the lam.

4.title: Remembrances
4.description: Wu begins his exile with Mako's family, and realizes that he knows nothing about his bodyguard. So Mako tells him the story of how he met Korra and their relationship since then, effectively catching the audience up from book 1- now.

4.title: Beyond the Wilds
4.description: The spirit vines in Republic City start abducting people and it's up to Korra to figure out why.

4.title: Operation Beifong
4.description: Bolin helps Opal and Lin save the Beifongs from Kuvira. Korra visits the Spirit World looking for help.

4.title: Kuvira's Gambit
4.description: Korra and Team Avatar try to stop Kuvira from moving against Republic City.

4.title: Day of the Colossus
4.description: Team Avatar clashes with Kuvira on the streets of Republic City; Pema and Prince Wu help evacuate innocent citizens.

4.title: The Last Stand
4.description: When Korra comes face to face with Kuvira, the fate of the Earth Kingdom and the Avatar's life are at stake.
